reference.title: Memory-mapped debug registers
reference.shortdesc: This chapter describes the memory-mapped debug registers and shows examples of how to use them.

link.desc: The following table shows the offset address for the registers that are accessible from the external debug interface.

link.linktext: EDCIDR0, External Debug Component Identification Register 0
link.desc: The EDCIDR0 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDCIDR1, External Debug Component Identification Register 1
link.desc: The EDCIDR1 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDCIDR2, External Debug Component Identification Register 2
link.desc: The EDCIDR2 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDCIDR3, External Debug Component Identification Register 3
link.desc: The EDCIDR3 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDDEVID, External Debug Device ID Register 0
link.desc: The EDDEVID provides extra information for external debuggers about features of the debug implementation.

link.linktext: EDDEVID1, External Debug Device ID Register 1
link.desc: The EDDEVID1 provides extra information for external debuggers about features of the debug implementation.

link.linktext: EDPIDR0, External Debug Peripheral Identification Register 0
link.desc: The EDPIDR0 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDPIDR1, External Debug Peripheral Identification Register 1
link.desc: The EDPIDR1 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDPIDR2, External Debug Peripheral Identification Register 2
link.desc: The EDPIDR2 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDPIDR3, External Debug Peripheral Identification Register 3
link.desc: The EDPIDR3 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDPIDR4, External Debug Peripheral Identification Register 4
link.desc: The EDPIDR4 provides information to identify an external debug component.

link.linktext: EDPIDRn, External Debug Peripheral Identification Registers 5-7
link.desc: No information is held in the Peripheral ID5, Peripheral ID6, and Peripheral ID7 Registers.

link.linktext: EDRCR, External Debug Reserve Control Register
link.desc: The EDRCR is part of the Debug registers functional group.
